greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Integers whose rote weight and rote height are equal, sorted by the equated value.
comment: The number of integers m whose rote weight, g(m) = A062537(m) and rote height, h(m) = A109301(m), are both equal to j is 2^(j-1) for j > 0 and 1 for j = 0, as enumerated by the main diagonal of the array shown with sequence A111793.
example: Triangle whose j^th row lists the integers m with g(m) = h(m) = j
j | m such that g(m) = h(m) = j
results.author: _Jon Awbrey_, Aug 28 2005
